utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, I’ve been working on an opening joke for our lecture at Berkeley.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, I like to laugh. But say it anyway.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, um, what do you say to a graduate of the UC Berkeley physics department? I’ll have fries with that. Because his education hasn’t prepared him for a career in the sciences.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, when they chase you out of there, you only have to run faster than Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you all set for your trip?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so. I just restocked the old PRK.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: PRK?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Public restroom kit. Everything a boy needs for making pee pee in new and strange places.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t see what’s crazy about bringing a backpack with your own toilet paper and Purell.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Keep going.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And rubber gloves, uh, air freshener. Um, noise-cancelling headphones. Oh, danger whistle. Um, pepper spray. Ooh, a multi-language occupied sign. Uh, let’s see, we have seat protectors, uh, booties for my shoes, a clothespin for my nose. Oh, and a mirror on a stick, so I can make sure the person in the stall next to me isn’t some kind of weirdo.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You still worried some Berkeley girl is gonna steal him away?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes, who do you think gave him the danger whistle?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Would you like to play a physics car game I invented called I Can’t Spy? It’s all the nail-biting tension of I Spy but the added fun of subatomic particles and waves outside the visible spectrum.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If it’s half as much fun as One Times Ten to the Fourth Bottles of Beer on the Wall, I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll begin. Uh, I can’t spy with my little eye something passing right through us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That soy Frappuccino I had.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will you please play the game? I can’t spy with my little eye something passing right through us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, um, if 65 billion solar neutrinos pass through a square centimetre every second, given the surface area of this car is about 60,000 square centimetres, that means 3.9 times ten to the 15th solar neutrinos?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t want to play anymore.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We haven’t been on a road trip in a while. This is fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We get it, you won the game. Stop bragging.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, listen, we wrote a paper together. Now we get to go to a university and talk about it? That’s pretty cool.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose it is. In fact, if you’d like to celebrate with a little music, I’d be okay with that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What? This road trip just got crazy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Play that funky music, white boy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m surprised you know that reference.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What reference?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: So, I put stickers on everything we’re gonna sell. We just need help taking it all out to the driveway.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Can I be in charge of pricing? I’ve been going to garage sales my whole life. Can you believe I got these pantyhose for a nickel?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, Amy’s in charge of pricing and being 75.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, Penny, can you give me a hand with this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure. Oh, we had one of these growing up. I used to play all the time.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? I love Ping-Pong.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, I meant beer pong.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I had a table, too, but I didn’t have any friends, so all I did was serve.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, you can leave one side up and play against it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And if I had a friend, they might have told me that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Excuse me. Why is there a sticker on this? It’s my TARDIS from Doctor Who. I was planning on moving it in the house.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I think you just answered your own question.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, one day, this may double in value and be worth half what I paid for it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sweetie, we have a lot to do. We don’t need to decide this right now.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I guess as long as you’re keeping an open mind.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So they’re requesting that the white boy play the funky music, yes?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And this music we’re listening to right now is funky as well?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Let me ask you this. Do you think this song is the music the white boy ultimately plays?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It could be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So it’s like the musical equivalent of Russell’s Paradox, the question of whether the set of all sets that don’t contain themselves as members contains itself?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well then I hate it. Music should just be fun.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Making great time. Gonna be there pretty early.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will our hotel room be ready?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I doubt it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Aren’t you worried that sitting in the lobby for a long period of time might attract the attention of the hotel detective?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If we do, we’ll just tell him to hit the bricks, see?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Seems a little confrontational, but all right. You know, we won’t be very far from Skywalker Ranch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, that’s true. It’s not like we can get in there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think George Lucas put his headquarters in the middle of nowhere because he wanted people dropping in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yoda’s swamp was in the middle of nowhere. Tatooine was in the middle of nowhere. Hoth was in the middle of nowhere. That’s code, Leonard. He wants us to drop in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We do have time. I mean, we could drive by and just look at it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Oh, I’m so excited. And I just can’t hide it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m about to lose control, and I think I like it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So when do you guys think you’re gonna move in?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re still figuring how much remodeling we want to do.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s tricky finding the right balance between tasteful modern and Jewish mother tchotchke crapfest.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Have you made a decision about the TARDIS? I think I can sell it if we call it Big British Porta-Potty.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’re not selling it, it’s mine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You can’t just decide. How about I arm-wrestle you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not fair. It’s like me challenging you to a sexy pants contest.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You could play Ping-Pong for it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I would do that.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How is that fair? You grew up with a table.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, but I mostly used it as a battlefield in an ongoing war between the Transformers and the ThunderCats for control of a bra I had found in the woods.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bernadette, for every episode of Doctor Who Leonard has made me sit through, I will play on your behalf and send that TARDIS back to Gallifrey, where I hate that I know it belongs.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yes, Penny plays for me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s not fair, she has upper body muscles.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, three-time Sanskriti School for Well-Born Boys badminton champion.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s right, okay, Raj can play for me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh, you just chose champions. It’s like we’re re-enacting the ancient German practice of trial by combat.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s also like when the Mountain fought the Red Viper in Game of Thrones.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Leonard makes you watch that, too?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no, I like that show. It’s got dragons and people doing it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So it’s settled. The fate of Doctor Who’s TARDIS will be decided by a Game of Thrones inspired death-match on the battlefield of ThunderCats versus Transformers.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If you still have that bra, I’ll give you a nickel for it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There it is. It’s just a gate. On a road.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wasn’t even that hard to find.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is so amazing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. You want to get a picture?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I want more than a picture. I want to go in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, so do I, but they’ll never let us.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that the attitude that helped you get Penny?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, but I don’t have three years to make that gate feel sorry for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There’s a speaker box. Drive up, push the button, and let’s see what happens.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, yeah. What do we have to lose? I’m a little nervous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, get over it. Confidence is key in these situations.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You pushed it, are you out of your mind?

utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: May I help you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Um, uh, uh, uh, we don’t have an appointment, and, and we don’t belong here, but we, we’re, like, crazy-big fans. I mean uh, buh, buh, crazy for Star Wars crazy, not crazy like we have a backpack full of duct tape, although we do have a backpack that you really don’t want to look in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re blowing it. We want to meet George Lucas and become his friends and play with him.

utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: Hello? This speaker’s not working, just pull up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And that’s how it’s done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, we’ve defeated the first challenge. Now we must steel ourselves to face the monster who defends the gate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re trying to get past a security guard, not rescue Zelda.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think what really needs to be rescued is your sense of whimsy, but one quest at a time. So what’s the plan?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I’m just gonna be honest with the guy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Honesty will never get us in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, what’s your plan?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, my plan is predicated on the assumption that they have a nurse’s office and your willingness to be lightly stabbed.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: Who are you here to see?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, I’m just gonna tell you the truth.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you are killing me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We don’t have an appointment. We, we’re just fans of Mr. Lucas’s work, and we thought we’d take a shot and see if we could get in and look around.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: Sorry, guys, we get this a lot. Can’t let you in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What if I told you that I was the voice of Yoda? A recording session I must attend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, don’t listen to him. We’re actually physicists. We’re giving a lecture at Berkeley later today. We just, we had some time to kill.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: Hey, listen, you seem like decent guys. I can’t let you in, but I got some hats and T-shirts I can give you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Thank you so much. See? Maybe honesty is the best… What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Shedding the yoke of my oppressors, you blind, sad little man.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: Don’t move. Code A-A-23, A-A-23.

utterance.speaker: Voice
utterance.content: Copy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can see the ranch, Leonard. Oh, it’s rustic, it’s lovely. I’d take a picture, but people are chasing me. I’m gonna make it. I’m gonna make it. They have Tasers, but they wouldn’t dare use… Aaaaaaagh!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, Raj. You are the King Kong of Ping-Pong. You are the menace of table tennis. Put her away, ’cause I don’t have a third one. Yes. Woo.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Rajesh eight, Penny four.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sorry, he’s really good.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey, Raj. if Howard can’t keep the TARDIS, how great would it look at your place?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, what?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t know much about Doctor Who, but if, um, you were to put this right outside your front door and open up the back, it would be like your entire apartment was the inside of the TARDIS, which is pretty cool ’cause on the show, the inside of the TARDIS is bigger than the outside. But then again, I don’t know much about Doctor Who.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t listen to her. You and I go way back, we’re like brothers.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We are. We are. Oh, no. What a terrible serve. Sorry, brother.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Eight-five.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I want a new champion. Amy, were you serious about being able to serve?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh, it, it’s been a long time. I don’t know. I’m probably pretty rusty.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s my champion.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, if you can switch champions, so can I. I want Raj.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, come on, like you even care.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I care. Oh, wait, no, I don’t. Good luck, Raj.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, I thought our friendship meant more to you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So did I.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you think they’re gonna call the police?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe they’ll call Imperial Officers to take us to a holding cell on the Death Star.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I think that’s below the pay grade of an Imperial Officer. Stormtroopers are really the ones who…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, shut up.

utterance.speaker: Nerdy Guy
utterance.content: He’s right. Uh, Stormtroopers actually combine both the function of infantry and military police.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh, I’m normally very nice, but you shut up, too.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, what are you in for?

utterance.speaker: Nerdy Guy
utterance.content: Honestly, I just wanted to meet Mr. Lucas and say thank you. You know, growing up, the movies had such an impact on my life. I never really fit in anywhere. Till I discovered the worlds he created and finally found a place where I belong.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Nerdy Guy
utterance.content: Oh, I, uh, I hopped a fence, and they caught me in the sculpture gallery making out with a Chewbacca statue.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. Leonard, they have a sculpture gallery.

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: All right, I talked to my supervisor, and we’re gonna let you go with a warning. But if you ever come back, we will call the police and press charges.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We understand. Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: Nerdy Guy
utterance.content: Uh, what about me?

utterance.speaker: Security Guard
utterance.content: No, you’re not going anywhere, kissy face. Let’s go. I have to take your picture to post at the guard gate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Uh, one question about that picture. Can it be with George Lucas? Ooh, grumpy you are.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, this is the match that decides it all. First to 11 wins. Serve switches every five points. And just so you know, when this started, I was going to put the TARDIS in a discreet corner of the house, but I’ve since turned mean, and now it’s going right in the middle of the living room on a rotating platform with a sign that says suck it. Game on.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Except, Raj is gonna win. Isn’t that right, Raj?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I mean, her serve was pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, get in her head. Be intimidating.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, I’m gonna own you, bitch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s not nice.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Let’s just play.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: One-zero. Two. Three. Four. Five-nothing. Wait, did you play badminton or sad-minton?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t listen to him, all she’s got is a serve. Now, grab a fresh tampon and put her away.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What, and that’s not offensive? Where’s the line?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s in your purse. Play.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: One-five. Two-five. Three-five. Four-five. Five-five.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Six. Seven. Eight. Nine. Ten-five.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Six. Seven. Eight. Nine. Ten-ten.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, that was an exciting 40 seconds.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It was, and now the serve is back to you, and the game is over.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, Amy, I, uh, can’t help but wonder how Sheldon would react if the TARDIS was at your place.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Don’t listen to her, just hit the ball.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Keep talking.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: If this doesn’t get him into your bedroom, nothing will.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you still mad at me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, we missed our lecture, we were almost arrested, and you got me locked in a room with a man who forced his tongue down the throat of a stuffed Wookiee.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Boy, some people are just glass-half-empty.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: The glass is empty, Sheldon. It’s completely empty. If you gave that glass to a man who was dying of thirst, he would be dead, do you know why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Before I answer, was he a smoker? I think you’re looking at this all wrong.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, then tell me how I should be looking at it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, not only did we go to Skywalker Ranch, we got in. And no one we know can say that. And for all the times you find me irritating, today you got to watch someone shoot me with a Taser.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That part was pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: See?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You did flop around a lot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll take your word for it. I was too busy trying not to defecate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, when they were escorting us to the detaining room, I looked through a door, and I’m pretty sure I saw a display case with the Ark of the Covenant.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s amazing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I saw Jabba the Hutt riding by on a motorcycle. Although that was right after the Tasing, so who can say for sure?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I guess this could count as an adventure.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was. And even though we’re not allowed back there, they can never take today away from us. Unlike my sense of smell, which hasn’t returned since the Tasing. No, I got nothing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, the Daleks are right on my tail, quick, we need to reset the time circuits. Oh, no, I left my sonic screwdriver behind.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really should have thought this through.
